abstract: Federal grand jury indicts Mohammed Hamzah Khan, 19-year-old Muslim from Chicago, on terrorism charges; is one of several disaffected Muslims in West who had become radical and tried to travel to Middle East to fight alongside Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: Mohammed Hamzah Khan, a 19-year-old Muslim, was charged with trying to travel to Syria in October to join the terrorist army trying to overthrow governments in the Middle East.
snippet: Mohammed Hamzah Khan, a 19-year-old Muslim, was charged with trying to travel to Syria in October to join the terrorist army trying to overthrow governments in the Middle East.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Chicago Man Is Indicted on Charge of Trying to Aid ISIS
headline.print_headline: Chicago Man Is Indicted on Charge of Trying to Aid ISIS
